critique: This document primarily concerns the internal organization and operational procedures of the US Foreign Service, particularly regarding its interactions with other departments like the Navy, Treasury, and Veterans' Administration. It establishes protocols for assigning attachés, defining their duties, determining relative rank, and managing interactions between naval officers and Foreign Service officers. There is also guidance on quarantine laws, relief for stranded Coast Guard personnel, and duties related to Veterans' Administration activities abroad. The document cancels some previous regulations and revokes a couple of executive orders. Given the nature of the document, it doesn't directly address many of the axes of political bias. It has a slight impact on federalism and executive power, but is mostly neutral.
